com.milk.objed
Class DirectValueEditor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.objed.BaseEditor
        |
        +--com.milk.objed.DirectValueEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Editable, Editor, ValueEditor
public final class DirectValueEditor
extends BaseEditor
implements ValueEditor

This class is a ValueEditor whose managed value is directly held in the object. It knows how to generically ensure that the value is always of a certain class or interface. It also provides public methods to set the description and mutability of the object.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

DirectValueEditor

public DirectValueEditor(java.lang.String label,
                         java.lang.String description,
                         boolean mutability,
                         java.lang.Object value,
                         java.lang.Class restriction,
                         boolean allowNull)
                  throws BadValueException
Construct a DirectValueEditor.

Parameters:
label - the label
description - the initial description
mutability - the initial mutability
value - null-ok; the initial value
restriction - null-ok; if non-null, the class/interface that the value must be an instance of
allowNull - whether (true) or not (false) null is a valid value
Throws:
BadValueException - thrown if the value as specified doesn't meet the restrictions as specified

setValue

public final void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
                    throws BadValueException
Set a new value for the editor. If restrictions were specified on construction, then those restrictions are checked before actually setting the value. If the value actually did change, then a valueChanged event is sent to all listeners.

Specified by:
setValue in interface ValueEditor
Parameters:
value - the new value
Throws:
BadValueException - thrown if the value is inappropriate for this editor
ImmutableException - thrown if the editor is in fact immutable

update

public void update()
Ask this editor to update its internal state. In this case, it does nothing.

Specified by:
update in interface Editor
Specified by:
update in class BaseEditor
